titleStmt.title: The answer of the Parliament of England, to a paper, entituled, a declaration by the Kings Majesty, to his subjects of the kingdoms of Scotland, England and Ireland. Printed at Edinburgh, 1650. Whereunto is annexed, copies of four letters to the King of Scotland, which were found in the Lord Loudouns cabinet. Die Veneris, 20 Septem. 1650. Ordered by the Parliament, that this answer and letters be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Scobell, Cleric. Parliamenti.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
Loudoun, John Campbell, Earl of, 1598-1663.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edward Husband and John Field, printer to the Parliament of England,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf consists of a coat-of-arms printed on the verso.
In part a reply to Charles II's Declaration by the Kings Majesty, to his subjects of the kingdoms of Scotland, England, and Ireland.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
